author: stefan2
msg: Enable mutex checks on named atomics to detect incorrect mutex usage.
This will cause the test suite to fail as our usage *is* broken.
Will be fixed with the next commit.
* subversion/libsvn_subr/named_atomic.c
(init_thread_mutex): Enable checks for correct mutex usage.  We can
allow for the overhead as we need to use expensive
file locks anyway.

author: stefan2
msg: Implement a TODO.
* subversion/libsvn_fs_fs/cached_data.c
(get_root_changes_offset): Instead of a plain APR file, take a proper
revision file struct as parameter.  That
carries information about the pack state.
(svn_fs_fs__rev_get_root,
svn_fs_fs__get_changes): Update callers.

author: stefan2
msg: Make sure 'svnadmin freeze' acquires the pack lock as well such that the
inner command being executed cannot violate the locking order. This makes
freeze in 1.9 also behave exactly as in 1.8 wrt blocking packs entirely.
* subversion/libsvn_fs_fs/fs.c
(fs_freeze_body2): New intermediate wrapper around fs_freeze_body
taking out the inner (write) lock.
(fs_freeze): Take out the outer (pack) lock, if supported by the FS.
Found by: kotkov

author: stefan2
msg: * subversion/tests/cmdline/svnadmin_tests.py
(FSFS_Index): Fix noob mistake and turn the members into instance variables.

author: stefan2
msg: Teach checked svn_mutex__t instances to detect unlock attempts on mutexes
that are not locked.
* subversion/include/svn_error_codes.h
(SVN_ERR_INVALID_UNLOCK): Declare new error code.
* subversion/libsvn_subr/mutex.c
(svn_mutex__unlock): Verify that there was actually a lock on this mutex.
